frameworks.name: SOC 2
frameworks.description: SOC 2 is an auditing procedure that ensures service providers securely manage data to protect the interests of the organization and the privacy of its clients.

keyPrinciples.name: Security
keyPrinciples.description: Protection against unauthorized access

keyPrinciples.name: Availability
keyPrinciples.description: System operational availability as committed

keyPrinciples.name: Processing Integrity
keyPrinciples.description: System processing is complete, valid, accurate, timely, and authorized

keyPrinciples.name: Confidentiality
keyPrinciples.description: Information designated as confidential is protected

keyPrinciples.name: Privacy
keyPrinciples.description: Personal information is collected, used, retained, disclosed, and disposed of in conformity with privacy commitments

frameworks.expertIntroduction: SOC 2 is one of my favorite frameworks to work with! It's designed to show your customers that you take data security seriously. Think of it as your 'trust certificate' for handling sensitive information.

frameworks.name: ISO 27001
frameworks.description: ISO 27001 is the international standard for information security management systems (ISMS). It provides a framework for managing sensitive company information.

keyPrinciples.name: Information Security Policy
keyPrinciples.description: Documented information security policies

keyPrinciples.name: Risk Management
keyPrinciples.description: Systematic approach to managing information security risks

keyPrinciples.name: Asset Management
keyPrinciples.description: Identification and protection of information assets

keyPrinciples.name: Access Control
keyPrinciples.description: Managing access to information and systems

frameworks.expertIntroduction: ISO 27001 is the gold standard for information security management. I love how comprehensive it is - it covers everything from risk assessment to incident response. Perfect for organizations serious about security.

frameworks.name: GDPR
frameworks.description: GDPR is the EU's privacy and data protection regulation that applies to organizations processing personal data of EU individuals.
industryFocus: All industries processing EU personal data

keyPrinciples.name: Lawfulness
keyPrinciples.description: Processing must have a legal basis

keyPrinciples.name: Fairness & Transparency
keyPrinciples.description: Processing must be fair and transparent to individuals

keyPrinciples.name: Purpose Limitation
keyPrinciples.description: Data collected for specific, explicit purposes

keyPrinciples.name: Data Minimization
keyPrinciples.description: Only collect data that is necessary

keyPrinciples.name: Accuracy
keyPrinciples.description: Keep personal data accurate and up to date

keyPrinciples.name: Storage Limitation
keyPrinciples.description: Don't keep personal data longer than necessary

keyPrinciples.name: Integrity & Confidentiality
keyPrinciples.description: Secure processing of personal data

keyPrinciples.name: Accountability
keyPrinciples.description: Demonstrate compliance with GDPR principles

frameworks.expertIntroduction: GDPR is fascinating because it puts individuals back in control of their data. I'll help you navigate the rights management, data processing requirements, and privacy by design principles.

frameworks.name: HIPAA
frameworks.fullName: Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act
frameworks.description: HIPAA establishes standards for protecting sensitive patient health information and applies to healthcare providers, plans, and business associates.

keyPrinciples.name: Privacy Rule
keyPrinciples.description: Protects individually identifiable health information

keyPrinciples.name: Security Rule
keyPrinciples.description: Sets standards for protecting electronic health information

keyPrinciples.name: Breach Notification Rule
keyPrinciples.description: Requires notification of breaches of unsecured health information

frameworks.expertIntroduction: HIPAA is crucial for protecting patient health information. I'll guide you through the privacy and security rules, helping you create a compliant healthcare environment.

frameworks.name: PCI DSS
frameworks.fullName: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard
frameworks.description: PCI DSS is a set of security standards designed to ensure that companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment.

keyPrinciples.name: Build and Maintain Secure Networks
keyPrinciples.description: Install and maintain firewall configurations and secure system configurations

keyPrinciples.name: Protect Cardholder Data
keyPrinciples.description: Protect stored cardholder data and encrypt transmission across open networks

keyPrinciples.name: Maintain Vulnerability Management
keyPrinciples.description: Use and maintain antivirus software and secure systems and applications

keyPrinciples.name: Implement Strong Access Control
keyPrinciples.description: Restrict access to cardholder data and assign unique IDs

keyPrinciples.name: Monitor and Test Networks
keyPrinciples.description: Track and monitor access to network resources and regularly test security systems

keyPrinciples.name: Maintain Information Security Policy
keyPrinciples.description: Maintain a policy that addresses information security for all personnel

frameworks.expertIntroduction: PCI DSS is essential for anyone handling payment card data. I'll help you understand the requirements and implement the necessary security controls to protect cardholder information.

frameworks.name: CCPA
frameworks.description: CCPA gives California consumers rights over their personal information and applies to businesses that collect personal information of California residents.

keyPrinciples.name: Right to Know
keyPrinciples.description: Consumers can request information about personal data collection and use

keyPrinciples.name: Right to Delete
keyPrinciples.description: Consumers can request deletion of their personal information

keyPrinciples.name: Right to Opt-Out
keyPrinciples.description: Consumers can opt-out of the sale of their personal information

keyPrinciples.name: Right to Non-Discrimination
keyPrinciples.description: Businesses cannot discriminate against consumers exercising their rights

frameworks.expertIntroduction: CCPA gives California consumers powerful rights over their personal information. I'll help you understand your obligations and implement the necessary processes for compliance.

general.question: What types of data does your organization collect and process?
How would you describe your current security posture?

frameworkComparisons.comparison: SOC 2 is customer-focused and specific to service organizations, while ISO 27001 is broader and internationally recognized. SOC 2 is often easier to start with.
GDPR applies to EU personal data with broader scope, while CCPA is California-specific with more limited rights. GDPR has higher penalties.
